alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 6:34PM PDT until July 12 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Okanogan County in north central Washington... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 634 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of the south and east ends of the Cub Creek burn scars well as small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winthrop, Falls Creek Campground, Chewuch Campground, Memorial Campground, Flat Campground and Camp Four Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
